What is the Pauli Exclusion Principle?
Option1: Electrons fill orbitals from lowest to highest energy
Option2: Two electrons in the same orbital must have opposite spins
Option3: Every orbital in a subshell is singly occupied before any orbital is doubly occupied

Answer: Two electrons in the same orbital must have opposite spins

Question: What is Hund's Rule?

Option2: Two electrons in the same orbital must have opposite spins
Option3: Every orbital in a subshell is singly occupied before any orbital is doubly occupied
Option4: Atoms tend to have a full valence shell
Answer: Every orbital in a subshell is singly occupied before any orbital is doubly occupied
